title: Turkish involvement in the Syrian civil war
summary: Turkey's involvement in the Syrian civil war began diplomatically and later escalated militarily. Initially, Turkey condemned the Syrian government at the outbreak of civil unrest in Syria during the spring of 2011;[131] the Turkish government's involvement gradually evolved into military assistance for the Free Syrian Army in July 2011,[132] border clashes in 2012,[133] and direct military interventions in 2016â€“17,[134][135][136] in 2018,[137] in 2019, and in 2020.[138] The military operations have resulted in the Turkish occupation of northern Syria since August 2016.[139][140][141]
